By November 2010, [[Jon Favreau]] had been tapped to develop the [[Magic Kingdom#Planned film|Magic Kingdom]] park into a "Night at the Museum" like film, with Strike Entertainment signed on to produce it{{cite news |last1=Graser |first1=Marc. |title=Jon Favreau enters Disney's 'Magic Kingdom |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118027299 |accessdate=September 11, 2018 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=November 10, 2010 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5v00gTWGB?url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118027299 |archive-date=December 15, 2010}} after a script by Ronald D. Moore was turned down.{{cite news|last1=Schaefer|first1=Sandy|title=Jon Favreau Says Magic Kingdom Movie Still in Development|url=http://screenrant.com/jon-favreau-magic-kingdom-movie-disney/|accessdate=April 26, 2017|work=Screen Rant|date=April 4, 2016}} Another Haunted Mansion film was in the works with [[Guillermo del Toro]] as of August 2012. [[Mr. Toad's Wild Ride]] ride film was in the works at Disney Pictures by January 2013.{{cite news|last=Tully|first=Sarah|title=Is 'Tomorrowland' movie tied to Disneyland area?|url=http://www.ocregister.com/news/movie-409540-disney-tomorrowland.html|accessdate=January 29, 2013|newspaper=Orange County Register|date=January 28, 2013}} [[Tomorrowland (film)|Tomorrowland]], first to be loosely based on a theme park area,{{cite news|first=Eliana |last=Kirshenblat |url=http://screenrant.com/disney-tower-terror-movie-writer/ |title=Disney’s New Tower of Terror Movie Seeking a Writer |publisher=Screenrant.com |date=October 23, 2015 |accessdate=March 29, 2017}} was announced in January 2013 for a December 2014 release. Also in 2013, [[American Broadcasting Company]] had ordered a pilot based on [[Big Thunder Mountain Railroad]].{{cite news|last1= |first1= |url=http://deadline.com/2015/10/tower-of-terror-movie-disney-theme-park-ride-john-august-1201592331/ |title=‘Tower Of Terror’ Getting Movie Treatment; Venerable Disney Theme Park Fright Ride |date=October 23, 2015 |work=Deadline |publisher=Penske Business Media, LLC |accessdate=March 28, 2017}} [[It's A Small World]] was added to the list of known projects in April 2014.{{cite web|last=Fleming |first=Mike |url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/04/disney-taps-jon-turteltaub-to-direct-its-a-small-world-feature-film/ |title=Disney To Make 'It's A Small World' Movie: Jon Turteltaub To Direct |publisher=Deadline.com |date=April 22, 2014 |accessdate=May 20, 2014}} Tower of Terror was given a theatrical treatment by [[John August]] under producer Jim Whitaker in October 2015, while the long-in-production [[Jungle Cruise]] gained an actor. [[Marvel Comics|Marvel Publishing]] with Disney announced in October 2013 that in January 2014 it would release its first comic book title under their joint "Disney Kingdoms" imprint "Seekers of the Weird", a five-issue miniseries inspired by a never built Disneyland attraction Museum of the Weird.{{cite news |title=Marvel, Disney unveil 1st comic under new imprint |url=http://www.seattlepi.com/news/article/Marvel-Disney-unveil-1st-comic-under-new-imprint-4878283.php |accessdate=October 17, 2013 |agency=[[Associated Press]] |newspaper=[[Seattle Post-Intelligencer]] |date=October 8, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131018022343/http://www.seattlepi.com/news/article/Marvel-Disney-unveil-1st-comic-under-new-imprint-4878283.php |archivedate=October 18, 2013}} On March 31, 2015, the first novel in The Kingdom Keeper sequel trilogy series was released.{{cite news|last1=Bevil|first1=Dewayne|title=Disney book writer Ridley Pearson heads back in time|url=http://www.orlandosentinel.com/travel/attractions/the-daily-disney/os-disney-ridley-pearson-returns-20150408-story.html|accessdate=May 1, 2017|work=Orlando Sentinel|date=April 8, 2015}} In May 2017, [[Freeform (TV channel)|Freeform]] cable channel aired a special documentary, ''[[Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings (TV series)|Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings]]'', based on the services provided by Disney Parks and Resorts unit, [[Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings & Honeymoons]]. With success of the May special, the show was picked up as a series with seven episodes in October 2017.{{cite news|last=Goldberg|first=Lesley|title=Freeform Orders 'Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings' Series (Exclusive)|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/freeform-orders-disneys-fairy-tale-weddings-series-1049359|accessdate=January 29, 2018|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=October 17, 2017|language=en}} However, another special, Holiday Magic, was aired on December 11, 2017 with the now six episode regular series starting on June 11, 2018.{{cite news|last=Sollosi|first=Mary|title='Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings' is here to make your magical wedding dreams come true|url=http://ew.com/tv/2018/06/07/disneys-fairy-tale-weddings/|accessdate=August 1, 2018|work=Entertainment Weekly|date=June 7, 2018|language=en}}{{cite web|title=Shows A-Z - disney's fairy tale weddings on freeform|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/showatch/disneys-fairy-tale-weddings/listings/|website=TheFutonCritic.com|accessdate=August 1, 2018}} ==See also== * [[Universal Parks & Resorts]], Disney's
